newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore shares end firmer, banks shine.
newsitem.headline: Singapore shares end firmer, banks shine.

text.p: Singapore shares rallied to a strong close on Monday, boosted by some late fund buying notably of banking and index-linked stocks, dealers said.

"The bank stocks just kept running. I did not hear of any corporate news but there was nibbling by funds," said a dealer. "Most of the banks have become good buys at current levels," he added. Among them were foreign tranches of DBS, OCBC and UOB. All rose by 40-60 Singapore cents.
Shipping firms Keppel Corp and Sembawang Corp, food company Cerebos Pacific and car retailer Cycle & Carriage boosted the Straits Times Industrials Index 26.35 points to end at 2,034.79.
Dealers said the shipping firms were bought up despite the dismal industry outlook as the stocks became increasingly under-valued.

Property counters got a lift from the good response and record price of S$1,100 psf paid for leasehold Bishan Eight project in central Singapore. The SES property index ended 6.06 points up at 688.35.

Indonesian-linked Van der Horst ended three cents lower at S$2.19 after trading to S$2.39 as concerns over its financial performance resurfaced. Market volume was light, at 95 million, with 141 gainers to 179 losers.-- Angela Tan (65 8703083)
